publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3726# Michael Matheson: Falkirk Community Stadium Project—That the Parliament notes the important social and economic benefits of the Falkirk Community Stadium Project to Falkirk District; further notes with dismay the intransigence and lack of co-operation from Network Rail on this project, in attempting to hold the local community to ransom over access rights, and considers that Network Rail should recognise the important value that this development has to the local community and reconsider its position in favour of the local community.Supported by: Linda Fabiani*, Alex Neil*, Andrew Wilson*, Mr Gil Paterson*

S1M-3726# Michael Matheson: Falkirk Community Stadium Project—That the Parliament notes the important social and economic benefits of the Falkirk Community Stadium Project to Falkirk District; further notes with dismay the intransigence and lack of co-operation from Network Rail on this project, in attempting to hold the local community to ransom over access rights, and considers that Network Rail should recognise the important value that this development has to the local community and reconsider its position in favour of the local community.Supported by: Linda Fabiani, Alex Neil, Andrew Wilson, Mr Gil Paterson
S1M-3726# Falkirk Community Stadium Project (lodged on 18 December 2002) Dennis Canavan*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3726# Falkirk Community Stadium Project (lodged on 18 December 2002) Brian Adam*
S1M-3726# Falkirk Community Stadium Project (lodged on 18 December 2002) Christine Grahame*
S1M-3726# Falkirk Community Stadium Project (lodged on 18 December 2002) Cathy Peattie*

S1M-3726# Michael Matheson: Falkirk Community Stadium Project—That the Parliament notes the important social and economic benefits of the Falkirk Community Stadium Project to Falkirk District; further notes with dismay the intransigence and lack of co-operation from Network Rail on this project, in attempting to hold the local community to ransom over access rights, and considers that Network Rail should recognise the important value that this development has to the local community and reconsider its position in favour of the local community. Supported by: Linda Fabiani, Alex Neil, Andrew Wilson, Mr Gil Paterson, Dennis Canavan, Donald Gorrie, Brian Adam, Christine Grahame, Cathy Peattie
